PetuniaQ1.Text: My gosh! I just can't believe it! "My beautiful flowers dead like cattle!" She hasn't yet noticed your presence

PetuniaQ2.Text: The woman proceeded to turn around "My gosh dear, don't sneak up on me like that. I might have a heart attack!" She exclaimed dramatically. "My name is Petunia, this is my garden or was more accurately..."

Options.OptionText: I'm sure it could still be salvaged
Looks like you should have taken a better care of it.
Flowers aren't worth that kind of effort

PetuniaQ4.Text:
That's quite true, but now that you're here I have an idea!" Petunia beams, a devious smile adoring her wrinkled face. "Destroy that dam for me sweetie, it would make my world so much easier" 
>"What? Why would I do that?" 
>"I heard about you, you're that fellow that is trying to fix this filthy world. Well I offer a deal. You destroy that dam and I will dedicate this garden to growing vegies and fruits that anyone may come pick out. So what do you say?"

PetuniaQ5.Text: Petunia looked up at you with anticipation 'Yes dear? Is it done?'

PetuniaAskAboutDam.Text: Petunia looked up at you with anticipation 'Yes dear? Is it done?'

BernardQ1-afterCrowd.Text: Welcome Traveler, haven't seen you here yet. I'm Captain Bernard, the mayor of this Village.

BernardQ1.Text: Welcome Traveler, haven't seen you here yet. I'm Captain Bernard, the mayor of this Village.

Options.OptionText: Don't have enough money yet, sorry.

DamDefault.Text: Standing closer, clutching the baseball bat in your hands, you are face to face with the proof of hard labour that the beavers had created. Are you sure you want to do this?

MerchantQ1.Text:
An energetic man in a purple suit and a large top hat spots you
'Welcome welcome! What may I interest you in today?'

MerchantQ2.Text: 'Feel free to check out anything you want! I'll be right over here if you need anything."glancing over the selection of items the first thing that caught your attention was the ridiculous price under each and every item.

Options.OptionText: This is absurd I DEMAND to speak to your manager!
Oh wow... Sorry but is the price negotiable?

MerchantQ3.Text: My apologies, I'm aware that it's expensive but there's nothing I can do about it." Resources have been getting scarce which sky rocketed inflation on even the most mundane items, - he bows apologetically.

Options.OptionText: Is there anything I can do to help?

MerchantQ4.Text: ''I tried talking to my boss about maybe producing our own renewable items, but he seems dead-set on importing all our products."It seems he gave up on making anything with what little we have'', the merchant answered, dejected."''But maybe you could talk some sense into him?''

MerchantQ5.Text: Busy streets with shops lining up at every corner and crowds looking forward to the next big thing as far as the eyes can see. This is the market square of Perlorn,"though at first everything seems to be the same, the look of desperation in everyone's eyes speaks volume.

CrowdApproachQ.Text: There are 2 man with bruises, they are both wrapped in dirty clothing

CrowdQuestOptions.Text: Our men got seriously injured by a falling tree in the forest. Without them we can't finish building the water channel for our fields. They need some clean bandages, there was a merchant in our village but he left yesterday and headed north. We would be forever thankful for your help, you might catch him on the crossroads and he might have some.

Options.OptionText: I can bring you a pair, but you have to stop chopping down the trees, the environment is important.
I can bring you a pair, the channel needs to be finished.

BandagesE1.Text: Welcome Traveler, would you like to buy something?

BandagesS1.Text: Welcome Traveler, would you like to buy something?

MinersQ1.Text: Hi, could you help us fix this equipment. We would like to reopen the mine and recycle this old stuff. So far it looks like piece of junk displaying some nonsense.

MineQuiz.Text:
You see a small display with few buttons below, after pressing the biggest one it come to life and displays something that looks like a question:
0, 0, 1, 1, 2, 4, 7, 13, 24, 44, __, 149

MineQuiz2.Text: Which of these strategies could have the greatest long-term impact on achieving SDG 12?

Options.OptionText: Encouraging individuals to recycle more often.
Educating consumers about the environmental impact of their choices.
Imposing higher taxes on businesses with unsustainable practices.
Shifting global production systems toward circular economy models.
